page.title: 02HISTORY OF SCISSETT cont.
page.content: Joseph Norton built a row of houses known as the Fleet. They were designed with peoples comfort in mind, the upper floor being used to house looms and weaving accessories, to keep them separate from the living room. Later, Saville St. and Water St. were built but there was no provision for weaving because this had moved to the mills. In the middle 19th century the village expanded rapidly and the Norton Bros. employed 1000 workers. The rapid expansion meant a shortage of church space and St. Augustines was built and consecrated in 1839. The chancel was added in 1901.
